name: Mackay
summary: Mining is a major driver; the region is heavily reliant on mining, creating cyclical employment patterns correlated with commodity cycles. Combined economy with Isaac and Whitsunday; gross regional product close to $30bn (~6% of Queensland's economy). Over two million visitors and over $2bn visitor expenditure in 2023; 10% of Queensland agricultural production and 28% of Australia's sugarcane production; unemployment rate 3.9%; largest metallurgical coal deposits in Australia; Paget Industrial Estate described as the largest mining services industrial precinct in the southern hemisphere. METS base: estimated 700+ businesses; Paget ~40% of METS businesses; Mackay City ~12% with high share of technical consulting. Resources Centre of Excellence in Paget: training, innovation, demonstration; Stage 2 Future Industries Hub supported with Queensland Government funding.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Critical minerals (value chain adjacency; common-user processing)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: METS capabilities support servicing critical minerals opportunities beyond the region; common-user processing infrastructure can be catalytic.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Renewable energy (project pipeline; participation barriers)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Durable pipeline exists; local capture constrained by awareness, skills gaps, and procurement structure.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Bioenergy (existing biofuel history; knowledge and feedstock perceptions)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Region can progress bioenergy opportunities, but needs clearer market understanding and value chain targeting.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Biomanufacturing (future foods; certification and process capability)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Fabrication and maintenance adjacency exists; bankability depends on certification pathways and process capability building.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Circular economy (mining value chain; lifecycle and regulation barriers)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Circular opportunities exist, but require capability uplift and regulatory navigation to scale.

name: Isaac
summary: Part of Greater Whitsunday combined economy; gross regional product close to $30bn (~6% of Queensland's economy). Moranbah ~13% of METS businesses, emphasising proximity-dependent services (equipment hire and mine-site services). Mining-driven; cyclical employment; post-mining land use and circular economy relevance.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Circular economy (mining value chain; lifecycle and regulation barriers)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Circular opportunities exist, but require capability uplift and regulatory navigation to scale.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Post-mining land use (mine closure scale; risk allocation clarity)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Scalable project class is possible, but requires governance, risk allocation, and multi-stakeholder planning.

name: Whitsunday
summary: Part of Greater Whitsunday combined economy. Bowen Orbital Spaceport: licensing noted; one of only three dedicated orbital launch sites globally. Over two million visitors and over $2bn visitor expenditure in 2023.

opportunityHypotheses.name: Space (Bowen spaceport adjacency; standards and demand uncertainty)
opportunityHypotheses.summary: Initial manufacturing and services opportunities exist, but entry is constrained by standards and near-term demand uncertainty.
